sen.j: 狩野 尚信（かのう なおのぶ、慶長12年10月6日 (旧暦)（1607年11月25日） - 慶安3年4月7日 (旧暦)（1650年5月7日））は江戸時代初期の狩野派の絵師。
sen.e: Naonobu KANO (November 25, 1607 to May 7, 1650) was a painter at Kano school of the early Edo period.
Naonobu KANO (November 25, 1607-May 7, 1650) was a painter of Kano school in the early Edo period.

sen.j: 狩野孝信の次男で狩野探幽の弟にあたり、子に狩野常信がいる。
sen.e: Being Takanobu KANO's second son and thus Tanyu KANO's younger brother, he had a child called Tsunenobu KANO.

sen.e: His common name was Shume and he used the title Jitekisai.

sen.j: 兄探幽に続き、寛永7年（1630年）江戸に召され竹川町に屋敷を拝領し、幕府の御用絵師となる。
sen.e: Succeeding his elder brother Tanyu, he was invited to the residence in Takekawa-cho of theEdo region in 1630, and became a private painter of the shogunate.

sen.j: 探幽の画風を素早く習得し、二条城、聖衆来迎寺、知恩院障壁画の制作では兄と共に参加し、その画業を補佐した。
sen.e: Soon, he mastered Tanyu's style of painting and joined with his elder brother in making the wall pictures of Nijo Castle, Shojuraigo-ji Temple, and Chion-in Temple.

sen.j: その後、探幽の画風から一歩踏み出し、探幽以上に湿潤な墨調をもった。
sen.e: Later on, he spun off from Tanyu's painting style with a more moist black-and-white ink style.

sen.j: 大和絵の白描技法を水墨画の人物描写に応用し、漢画の和様化に寄与した。
sen.e: He applied the hakubyo (white drawing) technique of Japanese painting to the watery ink painting in drawing a person, and thus contributed to the Japanization of the Chinese painting style.

sen.j: 近衛家熙は『槐記』のなかで、古今に超絶したものだと高く評価している。

sen.j: 一方、金碧障壁画の着色作品は、対象を単純化し要とする傾向が見られ、探幽が金碧画の中にも和様化を目指したのに対し、尚信は装飾化へ向かおうとしたようだ。
sen.e: On the other hand, it seems that the gold-and-blue partition pictures between rooms tended to have simplification of objects, with Tanyu's partition pictures aiming at Japanizing, while Naonobu's work tended to decorate.

On the other hand, Naonobu's kinpeki-shohekiga (paintings on gold foil-pressed paper sliding doors and screens) tended to have simplification of objects, so he seems to have tended to decorate his work while Tanyu's kinpeki-shohekiga aiming at Japanizing.
